data.text:
Short on time? Forgot what you read?

Refer to "Drive- The Recap," p. 203 in the book, for a quick review of each chapter.

Or watch one of the videos linked on this page.

How to join the virtual book discussion?

​Contact WEA Academy- https://weaacademy.org/product/drive/

Virtual Discussion Tips

Zoom will be used for book discussions. Here are a few tips for a great meeting...

Feel free to speak! It can be a little uncomfortable knowing when, how, or if you should voice an opinion but all thoughts are welcome... that's what makes a book discussion great!

Mute when not speaking. You were just told to speak, now you're told to mute yourself! Muting when you're not speaking will just help the sound for everyone.

A tip for offering a differing opinion-- preface your statement by using the word "and" instead of "but." You are offering another view with "and," while "but" often carries a tone of judgment. Remember, differing views are good, they lead to great discussion and better understanding. If you don't agree with the discussion or the author, speak up and say why.

Daniel Pink outlines the premise behind what drives us today.
